intro: Cestrum stuebelii var. longispicatum, commonly known as the long-spined cestrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. The flowers are usually fragrant, with white or pale pink petals, and are borne in clusters at the ends of branches.
